intro: Tarachia paradoxa, commonly known as the paradox sandburs, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny seed pods that mature into burrs. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often greenish-yellow in color, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Tarachia paradoxa plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
